segment.source: How to activate an app (DirectX and C++)
segment.target: How to activate an app (DirectX and C++)

segment.source: This topic shows how to define the activation experience for a Universal Windows Platform (UWP) DirectX app.
segment.target: This topic shows how to define the activation experience for a Universal Windows Platform (UWP) DirectX app.

segment.source: How to activate an app (DirectX and C++)
segment.target: How to activate an app (DirectX and C++)

segment.source: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
segment.target: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

segment.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive \]

segment.source: This topic shows how to define the activation experience for a Universal Windows Platform (UWP) DirectX app.
segment.target: This topic shows how to define the activation experience for a Universal Windows Platform (UWP) DirectX app.

segment.source: Register the app activation event handler
segment.target: Register the app activation event handler

segment.source: First, register to handle the CoreApplicationView::Activated event, which is raised when your app is started and initialized by the operating system.
segment.target: First, register to handle the CoreApplicationView::Activated event, which is raised when your app is started and initialized by the operating system.

segment.source: Add this code to your implementation of the IFrameworkView::Initialize method of your view provider (named MyViewProvider in the example):
segment.target: Add this code to your implementation of the IFrameworkView::Initialize method of your view provider (named MyViewProvider in the example):

segment.source: Activate the CoreWindow instance for the app
segment.target: Activate the CoreWindow instance for the app

segment.source: When your app starts, you must obtain a reference to the CoreWindow for your app.
segment.target: When your app starts, you must obtain a reference to the CoreWindow for your app.

segment.source: CoreWindow contains the window event message dispatcher that your app uses to process window events.
segment.target: CoreWindow contains the window event message dispatcher that your app uses to process window events.

segment.source: Obtain this reference in your callback for the app activation event by calling CoreWindow::GetForCurrentThread.
segment.target: Obtain this reference in your callback for the app activation event by calling CoreWindow::GetForCurrentThread.

segment.source: Once you have obtained this reference, activate the main app window by calling CoreWindow::Activate.
segment.target: Once you have obtained this reference, activate the main app window by calling CoreWindow::Activate.

segment.source: Start processing event message for the main app window
segment.target: Start processing event message for the main app window

segment.source: Your callbacks occur as event messages are processed by the CoreDispatcher for the app's CoreWindow.
segment.target: Your callbacks occur as event messages are processed by the CoreDispatcher for the app's CoreWindow.

segment.source: This callback will not be invoked if you do not call CoreDispatcher::ProcessEvents from your app's main loop (implemented in the IFrameworkView::Run method of your view provider).
segment.target: This callback will not be invoked if you do not call CoreDispatcher::ProcessEvents from your app's main loop (implemented in the IFrameworkView::Run method of your view provider).
